column2: mentally dismissing the vast majority as low priority
column3: but one in particular triggered his curiosity: it was from Art Bullock
column4: sent at 2:15 a.m. The subject line read: URGENT FOR FRIDAY MORNING.|The Ambition|Lee Strobel

column1: 02:15|It was the middle of the night when the phone rang. He opened his eyes to find the clock reading 2:15. At first he was too groggy to grasp why a bell might be ringing nearby
column2: but he shook his head and
column4: picked up the receiver and held it to his ear.|Blind Willow

column1: 02:15|At 2.15 am a policeman observed the place in darkness
column2: but with the stranger's motor still at the curb.|The Shadow Out of Time|H.P. Lovecraft

column1: 02:15|It did. When the alarm rang at two fifteen
column3: snapped on the little bedside lamp
column4: then swung his feet to the floor to sit on the edge of the bed
column5: holding his eyes open.|The Night People|Jack Finney
